actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide that support and maintenance (in cash or kind) furnished to an eligible individual by members of his or her immediate family shall be disregarded (and shall not serve to reduce his or her supplemental security income benefits) to the extent that it does not exceed $200 a month.

summary.text: Allows an individual receiving payments under Title XVI (Supplemental Security Income for the Aged, Blind, and Disabled) of the Social Security Act to receive up to $200 a month in support and maintenance (furnished by members of his or her immediate family) without a reduction in the individual's benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to provide that support and maintenance (in cash or kind) furnished to an eligible individual by members of his or her immediate family shall be disregarded (and shall not serve to reduce his or her supplemental security income benefits) to the extent that it does not exceed $200 a month.
